Sequence Information.Peptide Name: hBD-27 (human beta-defensin 27, hBD27; natural AMPs; UCSS1a; primates, mammals, animals;; 3S=S; Others: hBD-23, hBD-29)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Recombinantly expressed peptide is active against E. coli.  Refer to AP1315 reference for additional activity assays using synthetic hBD-27.Warning: It was found the synthetic form was inactive against 5 bacteria. More studies are needed to clarify its antimicrobial activity. It is proposed that the peptides encoded by DEFB23, DEFB27, and DEFB29 genes exert physiological functions in the male genital tract, which may not be related to bacterial inhibition in host defense (der Naturwissenschaften, 2003).Replaced 2007. Updated 7/2021; 3/2023
Literature Information.Author: Huang L, Leong SS, Jiang R.2009
Literature Information.Title: Soluble fusion expression and characterization of bioactive human beta-defensin 26 and 27.
